Package com.frc5113.library.motors

Class SmartFalcon

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.can.BaseMotorController
      • com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.can.BaseTalon
        • com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.can.TalonFX
          • com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.can.WPI_TalonFX
            • com.frc5113.library.motors.SmartFalcon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.IFollower, com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.IMotorController, com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.IMotorControllerEnhanced, com.ctre.phoenix.signals.IInvertable, com.ctre.phoenix.signals.IOutputSignal, edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.motorcontrol.MotorController, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SpeedController, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    public class SmartFalcon
extends com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.can.WPI_TalonFX
    Modifications to TalonFX-esq motors (commonly the Talon)
    • Auto-wrenching default talon configs
    • Chainable configuration
    • Encoder improvements
    • Readability / usability improvements

    • Constructor Detail

      • SmartFalcon

        public SmartFalcon​(int canID)
        Create a new Smart TalonFX with Falcon based parameters. Not Inverted and Coasts on stop
        Parameters:
        canID - integer CAN network ID

      • SmartFalcon

        public SmartFalcon​(int canID,
                   boolean inverted)
        Create a new Smart TalonFX with Falcon based parameters Coasts on .set(0)
        Parameters:
        canID - integer CAN network ID
        inverted - spin backwards?

      • SmartFalcon

        public SmartFalcon​(int canID,
                   boolean inverted,
                   com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.NeutralMode neutralMode)
        Create a new Smart TalonFX with Falcon based parameters
        Parameters:
        canID - integer CAN network ID
        inverted - spin backwards?
        neutralMode - Whether to break or coast when .set(0);

      • SmartFalcon

                   boolean inverted,

                   edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation2d position)

                                double I,

        Chainable, configure parameters for a PID
        Parameters:
        P - Proportional Coefficient
        I - Integral Coefficient
        D - Derivative Coefficient
        Returns:
        configured falcon

      • configureOutput

        public SmartFalcon configureOutput​(double diameter,
                                   double gearRatio)
        Configure the radius / gear ratio of the output of the motor (ie a wheel)
        Parameters:
        diameter - Radius of the output mechanism
        gearRatio - Gear ratio between the input and output (>1 means output is going slower than input, <1 means output is going faster than input)
        Returns:
        Configured motor
